The third stage of labour â€“ 
the placenta
After your baby is born, the 
womb can contract to push 
out the placenta. Your midwife 
will	offer	you	an	injection	in	
your thigh just as the baby is 
born, which will speed up the 
delivery of the placenta.
The injection contains a drug 
called Syntocinon, which 
makes the uterus contract and

helps to prevent the heavy
